instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message:
no external (off hdmi)
i tried good known lcd.
Chime is present - both speakers are distorted!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message: yes now i have image but still no backlight. i got two of these boards on my desk with same issue - hopefully when i solve one it will also fix the other. 12.6v on pin 1 on j9000.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message:
"12.6v on pin 1 on j9000."
So you have <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> and of course <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> too.
Do you get <SIGNAL>LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL>?

If not, do PRAM reset few times.
If still no result, remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and run a wire from <SIGNAL>LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>.
If works, do PRAM reset again.
Resolder all components (remove the previous wire),test and comment...

Consider to remove EFI password, if is the case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message:
3.3v on <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> 3.1 on <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL> is missing/very low ~100mv

i remove <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR> and run jumper from <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>LVD_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL> still no back light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message:
Check all traces and components around <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
Pay atention to <RESISTOR>R9708</RESISTOR>/09 and all return resistors.
Try known good LCD assembly.
Change <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.

Do all these tests keeping 3V at <SIGNAL>LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display/no backlight
threads.message: i changed <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> still same i get 2.49v on <SIGNAL>LVDS_BKL_PWM_RC</SIGNAL>
